name: Sediment Supply Potential (watershed/banks)
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Relative sediment supply from the watershed and near-channel sources. Excessive sediment supply can increase turbidity, embed substrates, and degrade habitat.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Desktop (GIS/imagery) with field verification where feasible
howToMeasureMarkdown: Use available GIS layers and imagery (land cover, soils, slopes, roads) and local knowledge to rate potential sediment supply per the metric definition. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Sediment Supply Potential (watershed/banks)
inputs.type: desktop (gis/imagery) with field verification where feasible
inputs.helpMarkdown: "Imagery & Site data Land cover and soils (e.g., NLCD, SSURGO), DEM/slope, roads layers, and recent imagery."

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Low anthropogenic-caused sediment supply. Upstream bank erosion and surface runoff is minimal. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Moderate anthropogenic-caused sediment supply from upstream bank erosion and surface runoff. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: High anthropogenic-caused sediment supply from upstream bank erosion and surface runoff. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
